oai_dc:dc.dc:title: High variability in anthocyanin contents between different blackcurrant varieties
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hellström, Jarkko
Hietaranta, Tarja
Karhu, Saila
Mattila, Pirjo
Tiirikka, Timo
Veteläinen, Merja
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Food security, food quality and human health
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The results confirm that blackcurrant is a good source of anthocyanins. However, remarkable variation in the anthocyanin content between varieties is evident. The anthocyanin profile is always dominated by four major anthocyanins, yet some variation appears in their relative proportions. The high anthocyanin content is usually most desirable in the blackcurrant products and this study shows that the choice of variety may have a great impact on it.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Hellström, Jarkko; Hietaranta, Tarja; Karhu, Saila; Mattila, Pirjo; Tiirikka, Timo and Veteläinen, Merja (2010) High variability in anthocyanin contents between different blackcurrant varieties. Paper at: Plant breeding and management for human nutrition - How we can produce more healthful crops and food products? NJF seminar 419, Forssa, Finland, 10-11 June 2010.
